content: What is a Cancel Cheque for NEFT submission?

A Cancel Cheque is a cheque that has the word 'CANCEL' written across it, which ensures that the cheque cannot be used for any transaction. It is used to verify the bank account details for NEFT submission.
Do I need to provide any identity proof along with the NEFT details?
No, identity proof is not required for NEFT submission, but the Cancel Cheque and Consent Form are mandatory.
What should I do if the Cancel Cheque does not have the account holder's name printed?
If the Cancel Cheque does not have the account holder's name printed, a Passbook copy with the account holder's name must be submitted for beneficiary verification.
Can the Consent Form be submitted digitally?
Yes, the Consent Form can be submitted digitally if it is properly signed or sealed.
Is the NEFT Consent Form the same as the account opening form?
No, the NEFT Consent Form is a separate document specifically for authorizing the NEFT transaction. It is not the same as the account opening form.
What happens if I fail to submit the mandatory documents for NEFT?
Failure to submit the mandatory documents will result in the NEFT submission being rejected, which will delay the payout process.
Can I submit additional documents if I have more than one bank account?
Yes, if you have multiple bank accounts, you can submit the required documents for each account, and all will be processed accordingly.
How can I check if my NEFT documents have been successfully submitted?
Once the NEFT documents are successfully submitted, you will receive a confirmation message on the platform, and you can check the submission status in your account.
What is the deadline for submitting the NEFT documents?
NEFT documents must be submitted as part of the enrollment or Geo Verification process. Submitting them on time will ensure the smooth processing of transactions.
